comments.text:
Created attachment 543663
Sélection_001.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110701 Firefox/7.0a1
Build ID: 20110701110027

Steps to reproduce:

I pinned some tabs, and have normal tabs open too.


Actual results:

The tabs of App Tabs are too hight.


Expected results:

The tabs should be like normal tabs, stuck to the content of web pages.
comments.author: ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110701 Firefox/7.0a1
Build ID: 20110701110027

Steps to reproduce:

I pinned some tabs, and have normal tabs open too.


Actual results:

The tabs of App Tabs are too hight.


Expected results:

The tabs should be like normal tabs, stuck to the content of web pages.

comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Please attach a screenshot showing the issue

comments.text: Please attach a screenshot showing the issue

comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: A screenshot is already attached. Reporter, can you please reset your toolbar customizations or test in a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles)?
comments.text: A screenshot is already attached. Reporter, can you please reset your toolbar customizations or test in a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles)?
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: As you can see, I have a custom UserChrome.css that could be the source of this bug.
comments.author: ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 544205
My UserChrome.css (certainly the source of this bug)

As you can see, I have a custom UserChrome.css that could be the source of this bug.
comments.creator: ikolpm@yopmail.com

comments.raw_text: Please remove it from the profile and restart Firefox. Is it fixed then?
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: Please remove it from the profile and restart Firefox. Is it fixed then?
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.text: Yes, so it's a bug with how Firefox handle the userChrome.css.
comments.creator: ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.raw_text: Yes, so it's a bug with how Firefox handle the userChrome.css.

comments.text: So does the removal of the first entry help here?
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: So does the removal of the first entry help here?

comments.text: Yes, but it should stay at the bottom when the height is different.
comments.author: ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.creator: ikolpm@yopmail.com
comments.raw_text: Yes, but it should stay at the bottom when the height is different.

comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: Dao, how do we vertically align tabs and app tabs in the tab bar? Do we connect them at the top or bottom?
